intro: Isolepis platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited flatsedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Its distinctive feature is the broad, club-shaped fruits that give it its common name. Isolepis platycarpa plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
